Title: ConnMan: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in ConnMan, allowing
    attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

Background.Text: ConnMan provides a daemon for managing Internet connections.

Description.Text:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in ConnMan:

  • Errors in inet.c and rtnl.c prevent ConnMan from checking the origin of netlink messages (CVE-2012-2320).
  • ConnMan does not properly check for shell escapes when requesting a hostname via DHCP (CVE-2012-2321).
  • An infinite loop error exists in client.c (CVE-2012-2322).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All ConnMan users should upgrade to the latest version:
